intro: Sida cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually pale purple or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Sida cuneifolia is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to warm, humid climates.
